pronunciation: ABA'SE, [Fr abaisser, from bas, low, or the bottom; W. bais; Latin and Gr. basis; Eng. base; It. Abbassare; Sp. bare, low. See Abash.]

definitions.text:
1. The literal sense of abase lower depress, throw cast down, used by Bacon, 'to abase eye.' But word seldom used reference material things.
2. To cast down; reduce low; depress; humble; degrade; applied passions, rank, office, condition life.Those that walk pride able abase Daniel 4:37. Whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased, Matthew 23:12. Job 40:11. 2 Corinthians 11:7.
